channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Numerous black bin bags of rubbish, 22nd October
item.description:
Multiple black bin bags of rubbish around street tree. Fly-tips keep occurring at this tree.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heavitree Close, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: So many potholes and very rough surface, 22nd October
item.description:
The whole of Cecil Road has a terrible rough surface with numerous potholes. Very dangerous for cyclists. Is this road in the list for resurfacing please? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Cecil Road, Enfield, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car has a few parking tickets and has been broken into, 22nd October
item.description:
This car has been parked here for a few weeks and has a few parking tickets. I can hear people trying to break into it at night and it has a smashed window and back light. I’m concerned the owner might not know

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Belsham Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumping increasing, 22nd October

This is the second week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Beechway, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins kept outside for weeks, 22nd October
item.description:
Business bin completely full is left outside on the road for weeks with litter overflowing on the pavement. A bed mattress is also laid next to it. This is disgusting, probably attracting vermines, foxes and has been staying untouched for weeks. How in earth is the business owner allowed to leave its bins outside of the premises for so long and why have they not been collected over all this time? Please could you escalate this matter urgently and address it with the business owner?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DUMPING household waste, 22nd October
item.description:
For over a year now this property has been dumping its household waste into the front garden. It’s not just bits of furniture it’s house rubbish and garbage and we have seen rats in broad daylight running around over it. There is packaging from food containers and other items that’s getting higher and higher. It’s now becoming a hazard and it’s a health concern as they are opposite a day nursery and a school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Anne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish outside No 74 Reighton Rd, 22nd October
item.description:
Council cleaner left a couple bags of leaves outside number 74 on our street. These have been there for over 10 days. This is leading to others leaving their general waste there. Bin collection on the road was yesterday however no one collected the rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reighton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signage review request, 22nd October
item.description:
High street & ringers road. A request into the placement of the no left turn sign and the two no entry signs. On a few occasions I’ve seen cars try to and even turn left into rigners road. The no entry signs are set far back from the junction And the lift no left turn sign is sometimes hidden by parked vehicles and again is set back from the road. Can this all be reviewed? Can the lit no left turn sign be moved further up or another sign installed on the central island? Can the two no entry signs be moved forwards?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62a, High Street, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between Number 10 and 11 Regency Lawn, 22nd October
item.description:
There is a Man hole cover that is partly missing and has left a hole which is a danger to resident walking on this path, This is close to a school so every Moring and late afternoon children and parents use this route. this has been reported previously on the 6th Aug but has not been resolved. resident has advised at night time the pavement area is dark and does have good visibility which could cause some one to trip or fall down the Man hole. Please have this resolved Urgently. On the 6th of Aug two cones where placed after this report was made and following this the cones have been removed but the hole has not been fixed. The cone was removed yesterday
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Croftdown Road, Dartmouth Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: About 7 fridges or fridge freezers plus plastiba, 22nd October
item.description:
A huge amount of kitchen appliances and a bag of bottles and clothing items dumped on The Course Playing Field behind a house in Crouch Croft. It is an absolute eyesore and dangerous to children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crouch Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet
